result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L. Balcitis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Samantha L. Balcitis in court with attorney Thomas W Duffy.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of rights; acknowledges receipt of information; plea questionnaire filed; parties stipulate to facts; joint recommendation; Defendant pleads NC to Ct. 1; Court finds guilty and convicts Ct. 1;  PSI waived;  Sentence WITHHELD; 3 years probation; conditions of probation:  30 days county jail with work release beginning 11-14-2014 by 3:00 pm.; restitution $296.00 to be paid to Lynn Larson; NO CONTACT with Lynn Larson; AODA treatment & follow-thru by October 31, 2014; absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use without valid prescription; DNA sample/surcharge; any counseling deemed appropriate; fine/costs totaling $843.00.

Court finds substantial basis for bindover.  DE in receipt of Information State filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.
